content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" defines the terms "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized under the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The "Southern Nevada Water Project Act" authorizes various water infrastructure projects, including pipelines, pumping plants, and regulatory facilities. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "Acquired Land(s)" includes all interests in land acquired under Public Law 89-292. The "Southern Nevada Water Project Act" authorizes water infrastructure projects in Southern Clark County, Nevada. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired under Public Law 89-292, including fee title, right(s)-of-way, and easement(s). The term "Public Land" refers to lands that have never been sold. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired by the United States for the Griffith Project. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved from settlement or sale. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under Federal ownership and the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved for specific purposes under certain laws. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights and interests in the project to the Authority. Upon prepayment of $121,204,348, the Secretary will convey and assign to the Authority all rights, title, and interest in improvements, facilities, and Acquired Lands of the Griffith Project. The Authority will receive all rights, title, and interest in facilities and Acquired Lands of the Griffith Project, including reserved interests in lands patented by the United States. Additionally, the Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land and Withdrawn Land where the Griffith Project is located at no cost. The Authority will have a right-of-way at no cost across Public Land and Withdrawn Land for the Griffith Project, valid for municipal water supply purposes. The Griffith Project will have a right-of-way across Federal lands for operation and maintenance, valid for municipal water supply purposes without payment of fees. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description within twelve months. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the Griffith Project's right-of-way within twelve months. If the conveyance has not occurred within twelve months, the Secretary will report to Congress on the status. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and land permits to conform to the provisions of this Act. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, all applicable laws and regulations must be followed. The lands and facilities transferred will no longer receive Reclamation benefits as a Federal Reclamation Project. Upon transfer, the lands and facilities of the Griffith Project will no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected by this Act. The Griffith Project will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will remain unaffected. Federal reclamation law will still apply to water delivered to the Authority under contracts with the Secretary. The Griffith Project will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project, and Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will remain unaffected. Federal reclamation law will still apply to water delivered to the Authority under contracts with the Secretary. The United States shall not be liable for damages arising from its prior ownership of the conveyed property after the conveyance of the Griffith Project and acquired interests in land.
